intro: Psychotria lasiophthalma, commonly known as the "Velvet Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often consumed by various bird species. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
